Hi:
 I believe it is someone's misguided attempt, not understanding the
derivation of that piece, to make it more symmetric. Arnold


>>> ikkanshi@... 12/21/04 4:55 PM >>>

Hi all, I have had a new arrival for Christmas. This is I believe a 
Kyo-shoami guard from the early to mid 1600's, in sand iron and 
depicting Feathers that are used in the Tea Ceremony. Really nice old 
iron, the pics don't do it justice, I will try for better ones soon.

Question, the little plate of Shakudo on the upper right hand side of 
the seppa dai in photo 1, what purpose would this serve.

Cheers

Rich
